instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid on this board.

Light on charger, fan spin but no chime and no image.
USB mouse got no light.
CPU warm.

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1.74V

Not doing typical 3x ‘on/off’.
Got just ‘on/off’ and the ‘on’ all the time.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
threads.message: Check traces from <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> to Y1905. Any history on this board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
threads.message:
Continuity OK between
Y1905/1 and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/3
Y1905/3 and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/4

Resistance
Y1905/1 and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/3 = 0.3 Ohm
Y1905/3 and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/4 = 0.2 Ohm

Correct voltage on:
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/2
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/5
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/13

<RESISTOR>R1905</RESISTOR> 0.1 Ohm

Client says screen just shut down and won’t turn on again.
Before I disconnected and connected battery and was working fine.
Client came back after 2 days with same issue but this time battery ‘trick’ won’t help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
threads.message:
Could be absolutely anything. 

Few last things to check <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and thorough inspection for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> light on charger, fan spin but no chime/image
threads.message: Yup, without any other clues this thing is probably screwed. Could try another BIOS as last ditch effort.
